alert.note: Alert for Grand Canyon Country; Little Colorado River Valley in Coconino County; Marble and Glen Canyons; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas Hwy 264 Northward (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 6:29PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT THE COLORADO RIVER NEAR THE CONFLUENCE WITH THE LITTLE COLORADO RIVER IN COCONINO COUNTY THROUGH 700 PM MST... At 626 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Blue Water Base Camp near the confluence of the Colorado and Little Colorado Rivers , or 10 miles north of Desert View at Grand Canyon, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... LCR Confluence Overlook and Blue Water Base Camp. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. If on or near the river, get out of the water. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.
